result.execSummary:
The defendant Marqus Dontte Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges for actual employment and child care and 3 days credit.
Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

miscConds.notes: Pay a fine of $100 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.
AODA, treatment or program. Random screening.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marqus Dontte Jackson in court.  Kurt Allen Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin. IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the following property may be reclaimed by the Petitioner from the Milwaukee Police Department Property Control Section, located at 2620 W. Wisconsin Avenue, Milwaukee, Wisconsin:  $7,074.43. Final Order received, signed, and filed with court.
Final Order received signed, and filed with court.
MPD Inventory #15009735.
Return of property hearing at 11-23-2015 01:30 pm

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Marqus Dontte Jackson in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel, Aleta P. and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 60 days at the House of Correction with Huber privileges for actual employment and child care and 3 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine of $100 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) perform 40 hours of community service. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.
Justice Point report dated 11-2-15 received and filed./ds

Defendant Marqus Dontte Jackson in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
State's Response to Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds

Defendant Marqus Dontte Jackson in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  No Appearance by the City of Milwaukee or State of Wisconsin.

Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition.

Defendant Marqus Dontte Jackson in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing on 4-30-2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Order, signed and filed.
It is Hereby Ordered that Matthew R. Meyer, 1947 N. Prospect Ave., Ste. 102, Milwaukee, WI 53202 be substituted for Darryl E. Smith of the State Public Defender's Office, 819 N. 6th Street, Rm. 608, Milwaukee, WI 53203, as attorney of record for defendant Marqus D. Jackson, in the instant action.

Signature bond previously set at $500.00. Court reinstates signature bond and increases it by $250.00 for a TOTAL signature bond of $750.00.
Court orders defendant REFERRED to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marqus Dontte Jackson in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Danielle Chojnacki for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
ORIGINAL COURT FILE IS UNAVAILABLE.
